items.title: Bangladesh election: BNP wins historic first vote since overthrow of Hasina
items.standfirst: Voting was largely peaceful in an election seen as a test of Bangladesh’s democracy after years of political turmoil The Bangladesh Nationalist party, led by Tarique Rahman, has won a sweeping victory in the country’s first election since a gen Z uprising toppled the autocratic regime of Sheikh Hasina.Results from the election commission confirmed the BNP alliance had won 212 seats, returning the party to power after 20 years, while the rival alliance, led by the Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, won 77 seats. Continue reading...
items.content: Voting was largely peaceful in an election seen as a test of Bangladesh’s democracy after years of political turmoil The Bangladesh Nationalist party, led by Tarique Rahman, has won a sweeping victory in the country’s first election since a gen Z uprising toppled the autocratic regime of Sheikh Hasina.Results from the election commission confirmed the BNP alliance had won 212 seats, returning the party to power after 20 years, while the rival alliance, led by the Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, won 77 seats. Continue reading...

items.content: Voters are hoping for a return to democracy after 15 years of authoritarian rule under Sheikh Hasina.

items.title: Who is Tarique Rahman, Bangladesh's election winner ?

items.content: Bangladesh’s BNP wins a decisive majority, with Tarique Rahman set to lead after the 2024 uprising ousted Sheikh Hasina. Returning from 17 years abroad, he pledges unity, aid expansion, and political reforms.

items.title: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party wins majority in historic election

items.content: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has secured a majority victory in the country's first election since the Gen Z-driven uprising of 2024.

items.title: Tarique Rahman promises era of clean politics as Bangladesh holds first election since fall of Hasina
items.standfirst: Jailed then exiled in London, Rahman returns home as the main contender to be next prime minister of BangladeshTarique Rahman, who after 17 years in exile is the main contender to be the next prime minister of Bangladesh, has pledged to end entrenched corruption and put the country on a “new path” as voting began in the first free and fair elections in almost two decades.Speaking to the Guardian before polls opened on Thursday morning, Rahman promised a new era of clean politics, including a “top down, no tolerance” approach to graft, if his Bangladesh Nationalist party (BNP) was brought to power. Continue reading...
items.content: Jailed then exiled in London, Rahman returns home as the main contender to be next prime minister of BangladeshTarique Rahman, who after 17 years in exile is the main contender to be the next prime minister of Bangladesh, has pledged to end entrenched corruption and put the country on a “new path” as voting began in the first free and fair elections in almost two decades.Speaking to the Guardian before polls opened on Thursday morning, Rahman promised a new era of clean politics, including a “top down, no tolerance” approach to graft, if his Bangladesh Nationalist party (BNP) was brought to power. clusters.title: US Briefly Names Alibaba, Baidu as Firms Aiding China’s Military
clusters.neutral_headline: US Briefly Names Alibaba and Baidu as Firms Aiding China's Military

items.title: US Briefly Names Alibaba, Baidu as Firms Aiding China’s Military
items.standfirst: The Pentagon added Alibaba, BYD, Baidu and TP-Link Technologies Co. to a list of companies that aid the Chinese military – before withdrawing it minutes later without explanation. The moves on Friday roiled shares of the affected listed companies and left analysts wondering about the administration’s intentions. If the list is reposted, they said it would be a show of strength ahead of President Donald Trump’s expected trip to China and meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in April. Asked about the notice, the Pentagon said in a statement to Bloomberg News that “we have nothing to announce at this time.” Bloomberg News Senior Editor for Technology & Strategic Industries Michael Shepard joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: The Pentagon added Alibaba, BYD, Baidu and TP-Link Technologies Co. to a list of companies that aid the Chinese military – before withdrawing it minutes later without explanation. The moves on Friday roiled shares of the affected listed companies and left analysts wondering about the administration’s intentions. If the list is reposted, they said it would be a show of strength ahead of President Donald Trump’s expected trip to China and meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in April. Asked about the notice, the Pentagon said in a statement to Bloomberg News that “we have nothing to announce at this time.” Bloomberg News Senior Editor for Technology & Strategic Industries Michael Shepard joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: German leader Merz calls on US and Europe to ‘repair trust’
items.standfirst: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said a “deep rift” has opened between Europe and the US and called to “repair trust”.
items.content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said a “deep rift” has opened between Europe and the US and called to “repair trust”.

items.title: Germany's Merz calls for reset with U.S. as old global order faces change
items.standfirst: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz called for a stronger Europe to reset its ties with the United States as a dangerous new era of great power in politics rises as the old global order faces change.
items.content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz called for a stronger Europe to reset its ties with the United States as a dangerous new era of great power in politics rises as the old global order faces change.

ai_summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz called for a reset with the US
He said a deep rift has opened between Europe and the US
He wants to repair trust between the two
The old global order is facing change
Merz wants a stronger Europe to reset its ties with the US

clusters.title: Trump pardons 5 former NFL players ranging from perjury to drug trafficking

items.title: Trump pardons 5 former NFL players ranging from perjury to drug trafficking
items.standfirst: Ex-NFL players Joe Klecko, Nate Newton, Jamal Lewis, Travis Henry and the late Billy Cannon are all granted clemency.
items.content: Ex-NFL players Joe Klecko, Nate Newton, Jamal Lewis, Travis Henry and the late Billy Cannon are all granted clemency.

items.title: Why did Trump pardon five ex‑NFL players? #sports
items.standfirst: Presidential pardons and ex‑NFL players President Trump granted full pardons to five former NFL players, erasing federal convictions that ranged from perjury to drug trafficking. The White House’s pardon announcement, handled publicly by the administration’s clemency office, named the…

The White House’s pardon announcement, handled publicly by the administration’s clemency office, named the…

ai_summary: Trump pardoned 5 former NFL players
The players were convicted of crimes ranging from perjury to drug trafficking
The pardons were granted by the White House
The players include Joe Klecko, Nate Newton, and Jamal Lewis
The pardons were seen as a surprise move by the president

clusters.title: A familiar move with a new twist: Trump tries to cut CDC funds he just signed into law

items.title: A familiar move with a new twist: Trump tries to cut CDC funds he just signed into law
items.standfirst: A federal judge in Illinois quickly issued a restraining order after the Trump administration slashed more than $600 million in CDC grants to four blue states.
items.content: A federal judge in Illinois quickly issued a restraining order after the Trump administration slashed more than $600 million in CDC grants to four blue states. (Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)

items.title: Why did a judge block Trump cuts to health grants? #health
items.standfirst: Court halts administration’s attempt to withdraw public health funding A federal judge temporarily blocked the administration from rescinding roughly $600 million in public health grants that had already been allocated to four Democratic led states. The funds, which were administered by a federal…

$600 million in CDC grants affected
Four blue states impacted by cuts
Administration attempts to withdraw funds
Judge temporarily blocks funding cuts

clusters.title: #CIA: Video aims to recruit #Chinese military officers as spies

items.title: #CIA: Video aims to recruit #Chinese military officers as spies
items.standfirst: The #CIA has posted a video on its YouTube channel targeting members of the #Chinese military in an attempt to #recruit them as spies. The video depicts a fictional disillusioned Chinese military officer who decides to contact the CIA and comes after a recent dramatic purge of China's top generals.
items.content: The #CIA has posted a video on its YouTube channel targeting members of the #Chinese military in an attempt to #recruit them as spies. The video depicts a fictional disillusioned Chinese military officer who decides to contact the CIA and comes after a recent dramatic purge of China's top generals.

items.title: China vows to take 'measures' against spying after CIA recruitment video
items.standfirst: The CIA released a Chinese-language recruitment video targeting disaffected Chinese military officers, showing a fictional officer deciding to contact the agency to expose leadership lies. The clip encourages leaks on China’s leaders and military. Beijing reacted angrily, warning it will take all necessary measures to counter foreign espionage.
items.content: The CIA released a Chinese-language recruitment video targeting disaffected Chinese military officers, showing a fictional officer deciding to contact the agency to expose leadership lies. The clip encourages leaks on China’s leaders and military. Beijing reacted angrily, warning it will take all necessary measures to counter foreign espionage.

items.title: CIA makes new push to recruit spies from Chinese military
items.standfirst: The CIA released a new Mandarin-language video on Thursday appealing to members of China’s military to spy for the United States and work toward “a brighter future,” weeks after Beijing ousted a top general as part of a purge of top brass.
items.content: The CIA released a new Mandarin-language video on Thursday appealing to members of China’s military to spy for the United States and work toward “a brighter future,” weeks after Beijing ousted a top general as part of a purge of top brass.

ai_summary: CIA posts recruitment video on YouTube
Video targets disaffected Chinese officers
Beijing reacts angrily to recruitment effort
CIA encourages leaks on China's leaders
Video depicts fictional Chinese officer
